lexUnit.name: thin.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having little flesh or fat on the body.

sentence.text: There 's the Flake one , which promotes the idea that chocolate gives you sexual gratification -- and that girls who consume chocolate all day are thin and have perfect skin and teeth .
He was thin , and there appeared to be dark patches growing in through the grey of his beard .
He was thin , dark and sallow , with prominent brown eyes , and he could have passed anywhere as a Lebanese or a Palestinian .
I was becoming thinner and thinner .
She had become rather wispishly beautiful , thin with light hair and quick nervous movements .
A tall thin boy with straggly hair passed her a joint and Lizzy took it from him , inhaling the fragrant mixture deeply .
An all-nighter was a triumph of will and my eyelids were already dropping , but I kept my eyes on the thin figure .
The thin figure leaned over and whispered in the sleeper 's ear .
Only then did he see the thin figure of Louis leaning against the saloon bulkhead .
That was when he saw the thin figure jogging towards him in the gloom , and heard the roar of engines come up fast behind him .
A thin disdainful blonde girl led me up narrow stairs to a room filled completely by a single bed .
He saw a tall thin girl , with dark hair escaping from under her bonnet .
A shy , thin , very beautiful young girl , she was already pregnant .
The two in front were shivering teenagers dressed in thin cotton calf-length robes , a long haired youth and a thin elfin faced girl .
Endill had been dragging an ironing-board back from a room where everything was half buried in the floor when , turning a corner , he bumped into a tall thin man who had appeared from nowhere .
The thin man complained and continued to argue but no-one took notice but Michael , who growled tersely at his cowardice .
The thin man looked at the sky .
The very thin man with the very wiry glasses sits , bonily , behind a mixing desk .
A tall , thin angular woman in her thirties sat behind it , her long legs stretching out from under it .
On the corner of the street a thin woman propositions customers .
At the black ash reception desk a thin , middle-aged woman , with a bright gash of a mouth and hair in a severe French coupe , looked up sharply from her word processor .
She was called Frances , a thin pale woman with a frequent cough .
I know I 'm too thin , I do n't like what I look like and I 've been told if I lose any more weight I 'll have to give up work and be admitted to hospital .
His father , tall and thin , sitting in the lounge on a Saturday afternoon watching wrestling on the television , his shirtsleeves rolled up above the elbow in the old-fashioned way .
She stands small and thin by the curtained window , wearing a black sweatshirt , black wool leggings and pointed black suede shoes .
